results.title: Metformin use and the Risk of Gastrointestinal Malignancies in Diabetic Populations: A Meta-Analysis.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: Our findings suggest that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ could be a useful neoadjuvant agent for @DISEASE_Colorectal_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D015179 @@@CRC cancer@@@ and as a possible preventive therapy for other @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ conditions related to @DISEASE_Colorectal_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D015179 @@@colorectal pathologies@@@ such as @<m>DISEASE_Adenomatous_Polyps</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018256 @@@adenomatous polyps@@@ and @DISEASE_Inflammatory_Bowel_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D015212 @@@inflammatory bowel disease@@@.

results.title: Metformin use is associated with a decreased incidence of colorectal adenomas in diabetic patients with previous colorectal cancer.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: After a median follow-up of 58 months, a total of 33 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (28.9%) exhibited @<m>DISEASE_Adenomatous_Polyps</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018256 @@@adenomatous colorectal polyps@@@ among the 114 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who used @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, compared with 58 (46.0%) @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Adenoma @DISEASE_MESH:D000236 @@@colorectal adenomas@@@ among the 126 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who did not use @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (odds ratio = 0.48, 95% confidence interval = 0.280-0.816, P = 0.008).
